summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message of hope from Pastor Leo Bigger! In this powerful sermon, Pastor Leo shares a deeply personal and transformative message about finding hope in life's most challenging seasons. Drawing from his own experiences, including his mother's profound final moments, he emphasizes the incredible truth that Christ lives within us, providing hope and strength even in our weakest moments. Pastor Leo reminds us that life isn't always a smooth upward trajectory, but a journey of transitions, challenges, and growth. His message powerfully illustrates how comparison and fear can rob us of our God-given potential, while embracing our unique calling can lead to extraordinary breakthroughs. The most touching moment? When he shared how his mother's peaceful passing actually touched an unbeliever's heart, demonstrating that true hope transcends even death. Pastor Leo's personal story of building ICF from nothing to an international movement is a testament to what happens when we trust God's process and refuse to compare ourselves to others. The key takeaway? Christ in us is our hope, our strength, and our victory - no matter what challenges we face!
mainPoints: Christ lives in me, providing hope from the inside
Don't compare your journey to others; embrace your unique calling
Challenges are opportunities for growth, not defeat

versesMentioned.text: I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
For you died, and your life is now hidden with Christ in God.
The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want.

Then I heard a loud voice in heaven say: 'Now have come the salvation and the power and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Messiah. For the accuser of our brothers and sisters, who accuses them before our God day and night, has been hurled down.'

Monday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Monday.focus: Embracing God's unique plan for your life
Monday.action: Write down three things you're tempted to compare about yourself to others. Pray over each one, asking God to help you see your unique calling and purpose.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see myself through Your eyes. Forgive me for comparing myself to others and teach me to embrace the unique path You've designed for me. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 1 Peter 5:7: 'Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.'
Tuesday.action: Create a gratitude journal. List 5 specific things about yourself that make you uniquely created by God.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, thank You for making me wonderfully unique. Help me appreciate the gifts and calling You've placed in my life. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Wednesday.action: Reflect on a current challenge. Write down three potential ways God might be using this situation to grow you.
Wednesday.prayer: God, give me eyes to see Your work in my challenges. Help me trust Your process and grow through this season. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Thursday.action: Identify one area where you feel weak. Spend time meditating on how Christ's strength can work through your weakness.
Thursday.prayer: Jesus, live through me today. Where I am weak, be my strength and my hope. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Ephesians 2:10: 'For we are God's handiwork, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.'
Friday.action: Do something that celebrates your unique gifts. Reach out to someone who can encourage you in your calling.
Friday.prayer: Lord, thank You for creating me with purpose. Show me how to use my gifts to glorify You today. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Isaiah 43:19: 'See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection, asking God to reveal the new things He is doing in your life.
Saturday.prayer: Father, open my eyes to the new things You are doing. Give me faith to trust Your process and excitement for Your plan. Amen.
